title: BRAVE Day for Sophomores - November 14th
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: BRAVE Day at Talawanda High School is our annual family building and diversity event for our Sophomore class. The focus of the day is on making students realize that they are not alone at Talawanda, and they have many other peers and adults that care about and support them. Our students are a large part of our community, and by sharing stories, participating in activities, and most importantly - listening - they realize the important role they play with their classmates. Since 2009, BRAVE Day has been an influential part of our Anti-bullying, personal empowerment program at THS and our students come out of this experience better people for it.The event will take place…FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 14TH The effort that our students put into the day is an amazing thing to witness. Not only do students participate, they also encourage each other throughout the day on a level that is not normally seen in a typical High School. As a School District we appreciate their willingness to let go of their normal day and try to become a better person. Talawanda is thankful for them, and realizes that we have some of the most caring students around.If you feel your student would not benefit from the day, or would be negatively affected by the activities provided, they are not required to attend. We will not force students to participate, but rather want to provide the opportunity for them to improve as Talawanda students during BRAVE Day. They should stay in class during the event if they do not want to attend.

summary: **BRAVE Day** is Talawanda High School's annual family-building and diversity event for **sophomores**, taking place **Friday, November 14th**. The program focuses on anti-bullying and personal empowerment by helping students realize they are supported by peers and adults through story-sharing, activities, and listening. Participation is **optional** - students who prefer not to attend should stay in their regular classes during the event.

title: FCCLA Hosts Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: FCCLA is honored and excited to once again host the Veteran’s Day breakfast and assembly. If you are a Veteran, please RSVP at this link and join us on November 11th!

summary: FCCLA is hosting the **Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly** on **Tuesday, November 11, 2025** at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd, Oxford, OH 45056). All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. **Breakfast begins at 7:30 AM** and the **assembly starts at 9:00 AM**. Veterans should RSVP by scanning the QR code or emailing Mrs. Croucher at **croucherk@talawanda.org** with the veteran's full name, branch, and total number attending. The event is sponsored by BT/Talawanda FCCLA & THS and RSVP approval is required for contribution.

event_info.title: Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly
event_info.description: FCCLA is hosting the **Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly** on **Tuesday, November 11, 2025** at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd, Oxford, OH 45056). All veterans and one guest

title: PUSH Program Home Repair Grants Available
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
PUSH Program
PUSH provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 for more information. Application is attached. Http://www.push-oxford.org/

summary: **PUSH Program** provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. For more information or to apply, contact Jeanne or Sabrina at **513-523-8100** or visit [http://www.push-oxford.org/](http://www.push-oxford.org/).

summary:
The Talawanda School District provides multiple food resources for families in need:
- **Little Free Pantries** are available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly or more frequently
- **Backpack Program** provides weekly food bags on Thursdays/Fridays at elementary buildings (contact your building Social Worker)
- **Emergency Food boxes** available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours
- **[Calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule](Calendar)** available
- **[List of all Butler County food pantries](List)** available
- **[SNAP information](SNAP information)** available

For assistance, contact your building's Social Worker or Success Liaison (contact information provided on second page).

title: Winter EOC Testing Schedule and Information
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education
summary:
**Individual Testing (12/3-12/5):** For students needing to meet graduation requirements and first-time testers not taking the class at THS. Contact Mrs. Hess for make-up testing.

**Class Testing (12/16-12/19):** Only for students currently taking an Algebra C or Government class, administered during exam week. Make-up testing: 1/7-1/8.

Emails with specific test information and dates will be sent to students and parents before Thanksgiving Break. Questions should be directed to **Mrs. Hess at hessb@talawanda.org**.

blocks.content: Monday, November 3rdDiversity Club 2:30pm -3:30pm - room 400Setting Stone 2:30pm - room 320Tribune 2:30pm - room 315Tuesday, November 4thNO SCHOOL for studentsMock Trial 5:00pm - 7:00pm room 315Wednesday, November 5thRobotics Club 2:30pm - 4:00pm - room 412, All are welcome!Thursday, November 6thBest Buddies Tutorial - Cafeteria see insert belowChess Club 2:30 - 3:30pm - room 603Key Club Tutorial - room 218Mock Trial 5:00pm - 7:00pm room 315Project Green 2:30pm - 3:30pm room 224Robotics Club 2:30pm - 4:00pm - room 412Friday, November 7thDrama 2:30pm - 5:30 - PAC

summary:
**Club meetings scheduled for the week of November 3-7:**
- **Monday (Nov 3):** Diversity Club, Setting Stone, Tribune
- **Tuesday (Nov 4):** NO SCHOOL for students; Mock Trial in evening
- **Wednesday (Nov 5):** Robotics Club (all welcome)
- **Thursday (Nov 6):** Best Buddies, Chess Club, Key Club, Mock Trial, Project Green, Robotics Club
- **Friday (Nov 7):** Drama

Times and room locations vary by club. Note: Some clubs meet on recurring days - additional meetings on Mondays (room 400) and Tuesdays (room 400).

title: FCCLA Blood Drive - Save Lives
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education
summary: **FCCLA is hosting a blood drive on November 7, 2025** from 8am-12pm at the Talawanda High School Auxiliary Gym. The drive addresses the American blood shortage and helps those needing blood for illnesses, transplants, and other medical needs. Healthy individuals aged 16-65 can donate, and donors will receive **free snacks and a 1-hour rest period**. The event is TSD approved for distribution. For more information, contact **+513-273-3200** or **@CROUCHERK@TALAWANDA.ORG**.
